newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta shares seen continuing upward trend.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta shares seen continuing upward trend.

text.p: Jakarta shares price are expected to continue their upward trend on Tuesday after the index set a 1997 high on Monday with blue-chips likely to lead, brokers said.
"Some institutional buying will continue in certain big-caps, I guess," a broker with a foreign institution said.
Brokers said telecommunications firm Telkom, toll road operator Citra Marga and cigarette maker Sampoerna were likely to continue active.
They expected local investors to favour secondaries and medium-caps such as Multipolar, Matahari and Hero Supermarket.
Brokers anticipated active speculative buying and bargain-hunting.
On Monday, the Jakarta Composite Index rose 10.16 points, or 1.53 percent, to close at 674.13 points.
